title: Did signs of "closed in the event of an enemy attack " be placed during the cold war?
subtitle: In the early 1950s, efforts to prepare Americans for nuclear war included markings giving advance notice of the closure of highways in the event of an attack.
author: David Emery
vclaim: During the cold war, roads outside major urban areas were marked warning against the closure of specific main roads to civilian traffic in the event of an enemy attack.
